--- I noticed that they [DPH's scenarios]'re designed so 
> only a mage or archmage would have a fighting chance of winning...

Let me correct you on one thing.  Only an archmage does have a 
fighting chance of winning.  I tried with a mage.  The point of those 
were to reach the limits, which I did and which is why I will never go 
back to those except for the 1.6 billion dollar one.  I need to figure 
out some better scenarios for measuring character strengths.  
Obviously, a wide open area is best, but against what opponent(s)?

Anyways, I am starting to work on new scenarios that are going to be 
published again.  A graveyard scenario is next (can't wait to test it 
out), and then something around the theme of "The weakest link in a 
chain is the weak point of the entire chain".  After that, most of my 
scenarios will be built around a single character type.

> I'd like to propose a new trainable stat: 
> "Not-running-around-like-a-chicken-with-its-head-cut-off". Even with 
a 
> zillion armor, nearby explosions tend to send my characters prancing 
all 
> over the screen, running here and there and subsequently getting 
scared by 
> ghosts. I mean, how shocked and bewildered is an archmage with 
several 
> hundred intelligence going to be if a tower he was shooting at blows 
up?

Wait a minute.  I would like to have that stat for when I use 
exploding bolts with an Archer.  I mean if your character touched the 
invulvernablity potion and is still invulnerable, he/she should never 
run-around-like-a-chicken-with-its-head-cut-off.  The mega archers I 
have created have a slight tendacy to run off for minutes after 
launching a few exploding bolts at close range.  That is despite the 
effect I use the formula "Armor = Strength times experience" for  mega 
Archers.  I mean I could never make a dent in my armor with that 
formula without you-know-what-happening.

BTW, 8 messages were posted between this post and my last post.  
Consider that a long period of time between my posts.
